name: Line
description: The Line class is a 2D rendering component in JSMacros that provides functionality to draw lines on the screen.
overview:
The Line class is a 2D rendering component in JSMacros that provides functionality to draw lines on the screen. It supports custom colors, widths, rotation, positioning, and z-index layering. Lines are rendered using triangle strips for smooth appearance and can be used as part of custom HUDs, overlays, or visual effects.

This class is part of the JSMacros rendering system available since version 1.8.4 and is designed to work with the 2D drawing context, typically used for creating custom user interface elements or screen overlays.

constructors.signature: new Line(x1, y1, x2, y2, color, rotation, width, zIndex)

parameters.name: x1
parameters.description: X start position

parameters.name: y1
parameters.description: Y start position

parameters.name: x2
parameters.description: X end position

parameters.name: y2
parameters.description: Y end position

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Line color

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description: Rotation in degrees

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Line width

parameters.name: zIndex
parameters.description: Layer index

methods.name: setX1
methods.description: Sets the x position of the start of the line.

parameters.name: x1
parameters.description: The x position of the start of the line

methods.name: getX1
methods.description: Returns the x position of the start of the line.

methods.name: setY1
methods.description: Sets the y position of the start of the line.

parameters.name: y1
parameters.description: The y position of the start of the line

methods.name: getY1
methods.description: Returns the y position of the start of the line.

methods.name: setX2
methods.description: Sets the x position of the end of the line.

parameters.name: x2
parameters.description: The x position of the end of the line

methods.name: getX2
methods.description: Returns the x position of the end of the line.

methods.name: setY2
methods.description: Sets the y position of the end of the line.

parameters.name: y2
parameters.description: The y position of the end of the line

methods.name: getY2
methods.description: Returns the y position of the end of the line.

methods.name: setPos1
methods.description: Sets both x and y coordinates of the start position simultaneously.

parameters.name: x1
parameters.description: The x position of the start of the line

parameters.name: y1
parameters.description: The y position of the start of the line

methods.name: setPos2
methods.description: Sets both x and y coordinates of the end position simultaneously.

parameters.name: x2
parameters.description: The x position of the end of the line

parameters.name: y2
parameters.description: The y position of the end of the line

methods.name: setPos
methods.description: Sets both start and end positions of the line in a single call.

parameters.name: x1
parameters.description: The x position of the start of the line

parameters.name: y1
parameters.description: The y position of the start of the line

parameters.name: x2
parameters.description: The x position of the end of the line

parameters.name: y2
parameters.description: The y position of the end of the line

methods.name: setColor
methods.description: Sets the color of the line. Automatically adds full alpha if not specified.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of the line (RGB or ARGB format)

examples:
// Set color with alpha included
line.setColor(0x80FF0000); // Semi-transparent red

methods.name: setColor
methods.description: Sets the color and alpha separately.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The RGB color of the line

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: The alpha component (0-255)

methods.name: getColor
methods.description: Returns the current color of the line (including alpha).

methods.name: setAlpha
methods.description: Sets only the alpha component while preserving the RGB color.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: The alpha value (0-255, where 0 is fully transparent and 255 is fully opaque)

methods.name: getAlpha
methods.description: Returns the alpha component of the current color.

methods.name: setRotation
methods.description: Sets the rotation angle of the line (clockwise).

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description: The rotation angle in degrees (clockwise)

methods.name: getRotation
methods.description: Returns the current rotation angle.

methods.name: setRotateCenter
methods.description: Sets whether the line should rotate around its center point.

parameters.name: rotateCenter
parameters.description: Whether to rotate around the line's center

examples:
line.setRotateCenter(true);  // Rotate around center
line.setRotateCenter(false); // Rotate around origin (0,0)

methods.name: isRotatingCenter
methods.description: Returns whether the line is configured to rotate around its center.

methods.name: setWidth
methods.description: Sets the width (thickness) of the line.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the line in pixels

methods.name: getWidth
methods.description: Returns the current width of the line.

methods.name: setZIndex
methods.description: Sets the z-index for layering order. Higher z-index values appear on top.

parameters.name: zIndex
parameters.description: The z-index value for layering

examples: line.setZIndex(100); // Appear above elements with lower z-index

methods.name: getZIndex
methods.description: Returns the current z-index value.

methods.name: setParent
methods.description: Sets the parent 2D drawing context for this line.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The parent 2D drawing context

methods.name: moveTo
methods.description: Moves the line to a new position while maintaining its dimensions.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The new x position

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The new y position

methods.name: getScaledWidth
methods.description: Returns the absolute width of the line (difference between x coordinates).

methods.name: getScaledHeight
methods.description: Returns the absolute height of the line (difference between y coordinates).

methods.name: getParentWidth
methods.description: Returns the width of the parent container or window.

methods.name: getParentHeight
methods.description: Returns the height of the parent container or window.

methods.name: getScaledLeft
methods.description: Returns the leftmost x coordinate of the line.

methods.name: getScaledTop
methods.description: Returns the topmost y coordinate of the line.
